"If your password hashing system is secure, the only way to crack the hashes will be to run a dictionary or brute-force attack on each hash." can any one simplify this for me & say why ?

^ in theory, any encryption algorithm is susceptible to brute force attacks, no exceptions to this,
this means that if you have an unbreakable algorithm, and you used it to hash a word, this word is present in a dictionary and you ran a brute force attack using this dictionary and your algorithm against this word you shall be able to break it, 
you have 2 solutions to this, always choose passwords that are complicated enough so that the chance of finding them in a dictionary is minimal, and use a slow hashing algorithm, this would make brute force a living hell
